bullets.bullet_text: Gloucester, MA Systems Engineer Sept 2010-July 2015 Crion Cold Implant
Crion is a cold system that enables customer to implant wafers at -100˚C. The system consists of cryo-chillers, a vacuum-sealed valve system, and cooling ring to cool the implant mechanism.
Conducted and documented characterization tests for Crion by validating cool down rate, throughput, wafer temperature uniformity and overall functionality of the system.
Operated the tool during 40 continuous hours of reliability growth testing and helped release the product from R&D to Production.
Supported customer escalations by analyzing archives from the field and determining root cause of the customer problems. 26-Wafer Implementation

Led the project with a team of mechanical engineers, an electrical engineer and software engineers to create new hardware as well as software controls to implement the platen warm-up process. Released the hardware through ECO process to Production and conducted tests to help with software release. Center for Earthquake Engineering Simulation Troy, NY Research Engineer Jan 10-Sept 2010
Operated and troubleshot earthquake simulation machinery (centrifuge) while conducting experiments.
strain gauges, accelerometer, and pressure sensors.

Rotated through End Station (Robotics), Continuous Improvement and Physics Department (R&D) . Women’s Mentoring Program at RPI Sept 2006-Sept 2008 Co-Chair § Developed a new program providing opportunity for mentors and mentees to meet prior to the start of the school year. As a result of its success, this is now an annual program. Organized formal and informal events including: Chat with Shirley Ann Jackson (President of RPI) and Design Your Future Day to encourage women in science and engineering.

achievements: This is a program for new graduates at Varian to expose them to various engineering departments within the

Crion Cold Implant
•
Crion is a cold system that enables customer to implant wafers at -100˚C. The system consists of cryo-chillers, a
vacuum-sealed valve system, and cooling ring to cool the implant mechanism.
•

temperature uniformity and overall functionality of the system.
•

to Production.
•
Supported customer escalations by analyzing archives from the field and determining root cause of the customer
problems.
26-Wafer Implementation

Led the project with a team of mechanical engineers, an electrical engineer and software engineers to create new
hardware as well as software controls to implement the platen warm-up process. Released the hardware through
ECO process to Production and conducted tests to help with software release.
